alert.note: Alert for Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Southern Oxford (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Cumberland County through 445 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raymond, or 10 miles east of Naples, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brunswick, Cumberland, Falmouth, Freeport, Gray, Raymond, Yarmouth, Standish, Durham, Casco, Frye Island, Windham, New Gloucester, Pownal, North Yarmouth and Sebago. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 10 and 30. Interstate 95 between mile markers 53 and 72. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior Cumberland; Coastal Cumberland; Southern Oxford
